input_text:
Job Title: Electrical Engineer

Location: Vancouver, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Electrical Engineer III

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Ana Javalera

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $80,000 - $130,000 per year

A bit about us:

As an industry leader providing manufacturing, construction and equipment services for domestic and international clients, we offer unique opportunities for careers in a fast-paced and challenging environment. We are always looking for people that are team-oriented, innovative, and passionate about growth.

Why join us?

Would you like to work for a company that has great benefits, provides a positive workplace

atmosphere with an opportunity for growth, then you want to be a part of our team!

For over 50 years, we have been a leader in providing biomass-fired energy systems, lumber dry

kilns, and related products and services. Firmly established, we provide our customers with

complete services in design, engineering and manufacturing, as well as installation services and onsite technical services.

We are looking for a fulltime Electrical Engineer to join our team! This position is responsible for electrical system designs for

biomass cogeneration facilities, wood-fired energy systems, lumber dry kilns, and related products

and services. Duties include, but not limited to the responsibilities outline below:

Job Details

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

 Power System Design including Grounding, Duct Banks, Lightning Protection, Substations,

Power Factor Correction, Medium Voltage Switchgear, Steam-Turbine Generators, Motor

Control Centers, Power Distribution, Lighting, etc.

 Producing single-line diagrams, wiring schematics and other design and construction

documentation.

 Interfacing with clients and utilities to determine interconnection specifications. Specification, evaluation and procurement of electrical equipment. Configuring Protective Relaying and Automatic Transfer Schemes, Breaker Coordination Power System Commissioning. Training personnel on proper operating procedures of installations. Troubleshooting system issues by phone, online, and on site. Perform other duties as directed.

PROFICIENCIES:

 NFPA 70 - National Electrical Code NFPA 780 - Lightning Protection Systems NFPA 70E - Electrical Workplace Safety NFPA 13 - Installation of Sprinkler Systems OSHA ANSI Standards, Device Numbers & Acronyms

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

 Current P.E. license in Electrical Engineering B.S. Electrical Engineering Degree

Software:

 AutoCAD Electrical ETAP DIALux MS Outlook, Office

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

 Ability to occasionally travel up to 30% (domestically and internationally) and work hours

outside of routine schedule as required to support projects.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
